definition: to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
embarrassed
The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.
pinyin: qiao3 fu4 nan2 wei2 wu2 mi3 zhi1 chui1

definition: there are no rivers to one who has crossed the ocean, and no clouds to one who has passed Mount Wu (idiom)/one who has seen the world doesn't stop at small things
pinyin: ceng2 jing1 cang1 hai3 nan2 wei2 shui3 , chu2 que4 Wu1 Shan1 bu4 shi4 yun2
containing_words.word: 曾经沧海难为水，除却巫山不是云

sentences.english: The reporter wants to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing question.
sentences.chinese: 记者想用那些让人难为情的问题来刁难这位候选人。

sentences.english: The Qiao Fu is tough is one impossible mission, the nobody comes us to have what recruit son.
sentences.chinese: 巧妇难为无米之炊啊，没人来咱能有啥招儿。

sentences.english: Aim low, and don't be embarrassed to make these really, really easy jobs.
sentences.chinese: 目标要低，不要因为这些任务太容易而难为情。

sentences.english: It's really embarrassing when he acts up in public.
sentences.chinese: 他在外头耍脾气，真令我难为情。

sentences.english: Aware of this, Jesus said to them, "Why are you bothering this woman?
sentences.chinese: 耶稣看出他们的意思，就说，为什么难为这女人呢。

sentences.english: Come on, Mary. Don't be backward.
The obviousness of the lie was embarrassing.
sentences.chinese: 那是明摆著的谎话，真叫人难为情。

sentences.english: She said how hard it was.
sentences.chinese: 她说，这真是太难为她了。

sentences.english: When he started undressing in public I didn't know where to look.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭广众之下脱衣服，我感到很难为情。

sentences.english: The student felt very shy as he stood in front of the class.
sentences.chinese: 那个学生站在大家的跟前时，感到非常难为情。

sentences.english: " Hard to me. Lady's first. " --- Wine.
sentences.chinese: 难为我吧你，你先来，女士优先。

sentences.english: I felt embarrassed about how untidy the house was.
sentences.chinese: 这房子太不整洁了，我对此感到很难为情。

sentences.english: Risks, Once, after a few comments after suffering emotional experience.
sentences.chinese: 曾经桑田难为水，经过几番疼痛的感情经历后。

sentences.english: Don't be difficult, just lend us the money.
sentences.chinese: 别难为人了，还是把钱借给我们吧。

sentences.english: It humiliates me to think that I am of the same age as that baldy .
sentences.chinese: 想到我和这孱头同年纪，我便感到难为情。

sentences.english: Don't be afraid or ashamed to do things solo.
sentences.chinese: 不要害怕或为单独做事情感到难为情。

definition: to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to force someone to do something
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to show respect for/to think highly of
alas/oh dear
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
meddlesome/eventful
to blame sb wrongly
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to ponder earnestly/to give a lot of thought to sth
why bother?/is it worth the trouble?
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to feel very apologetic
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
